description.narrative:
Projektet syftar till att bidra till att förbereda samt stärka det lokala samhället och regionala statliga myndigheter/institutioner för ett aktivt och konstruktivt deltagande i fredsbyggande insatser, i linje med Colombias regerings strategi för fred (Paz Territorial). Huvudsyftet är att bygga upp ett förtroende inom regionerna, främja institutionell förstärkning och att effektivt kommunicera till regionerna vad det innebär att bygga fred. I linje med detta har OACP prioriterat tre komponenter för att nå de förväntade resultaten: 1) En mekanism för att finansiera nio fredsbyggande projekt som utformas och genomförs av lokala organisationer för offer, för att bidra till en bättre förståelse för offrens rättigheter och för att leda processer som främjar samexistens, 2) fastställa en kommunikationsstrategi för att öka medvetenheten och samla in information relaterad till försvunna personer inom ramen för den interna väpnade konflikten, 3) utforma och implementera integrerade skyddsmetoder för att förhindra rekrytering av pojkar och flickor till illegala väpnade grupper.
Projektet är relevant för att främja och stärka fredsskapande processer i regionerna som ska bidra till en hållbar fred i Colombia.

Strategic activities on peace building to be developed to support the preparation phase for the post agreement between the Colombian governement and Farc guerrilla and leaded by the High Commissioner for Peace.

The overall objective of the project is to contribute to strengthen the capacity of governmental entities and the civil society regarding peace building, in line with the government's Territorial Peace approach (Paz Territorial). The main objective is to build trust within the communities, promote institutional strengthening and communicate effectively on what it means to build peace from the regions. The project was initially planned to be implemented during a period of 11 months, from December 2016 to November 2017 at the initial phase of the implementation of the Peace Agreement signed in 2016. Due to the political context, some activities were delayed, others had to be changed, and the project was amended four times. Additional resources were approved in two occasion. The project was finally implemented from December 2016 to June 2019 with a total contribution of SEK 12 156 187.

description.narrative: The project contributed to the implementation of the government of President Santos' peace policy with a territorial approach: "Paz Territorial", in the initial months after the peace agreement was signed and after the peace referendum, in which 50.2% of the participants (approximately 40% of the colombian population) voted NO for the peace process (October 2016). The main results achieved by this contribution are: 1) Component 1 Capacity building and dialogue for peace building: Due to the political context in the regions, the initial activities planned for this component were changed. Two new main activities were approved to contribute to the implementation of the government's peace policy under the leadership of the Office of the High Commissioner for Peace (OACP). The aim was to create conditions and capacities in the transition process from war to peace in Colombia through: 1) a citizenship participative process in the territories and through 2) regional dialogues for reconciliation (Diálogos Improbables). 1) A common message, "En Voz Confio", promoting a common dialogue on peace, was designed and implemented in 30 cities in different regions of the country (Caribbean, Amazonian, Andean, Pacific and Orinoquia). 9,300 persons participated (40% women and 60% men) in the different activities, focusing in recovering the confidence in peace by the communities. 2) 28 leaders (12 women and 16 men) from the department of Cesar and 25 leaders (8 women and 17 men) from the department of Meta, representing different sectors and political positions, participated in the "Dialogos Improbables". A methodology was developed together with the leaders and implemented in 10 regional meetings (5 in Meta and 5 in Cesar). A set of commitments were agreed to contribute to the development of the regions, which were shared with governmental authorities, civil society organizations and political leaders. The most important aspect in this activity was the process undertaken by the participants, with discussions dealing with rural development, environment, human rights and peace building issues for their regions. This contributed to find common issues for peace building, despite their political differences and to establish a network among them. 2) Component 2 Information and gathering process of disappeared persons: This component was also changed from the original one agreed, due to changes in OACP's responsibilities. Capacity building activities were implemented to former FARC combatants, oganizations from the civil society, personnel from the Ministry of Defence and the Armed Forces, on how to gather humanitarian information on missing persons. 201 persons participated in an activity in San Vicente del Caguán where 166 biological samples were gathered to contribute to find information on 128 cases of forced disappearance. The results of this component where an important input to the Unit for Search of Missing Persons. 3) Component 3 Documentation and historic memories of the peace negotiation process: the objectives wer fulfilled. The information on the peace process between the Colombian government and the FARC was gathered, organized, analyzed, selected and included in the 10 books published, called "Memory Library ("Biblioteca de la Memoria"). This publication was launched and distributed in Bogotá, Villavicencio, Cali, Florencia and Carmen de Bolívar. Organizations from the civil society, governmental entities, universities, schools and the international community received copies of these memories. The translation of a summary of this publication in English was not possible due to the changes in the government in 2018. The new Office of the High Commissioner for Peace informed IOM that there was no interest in this activity and it had to be cancelled. 4) Component 4 Security guarantees: Two confidential documents with information on security risks for former combatants, their families and communities in Arauca, Cauca, Sur de Bolívar and Catatumbo were elaborated by Fundación Ideas para la Paz (FIP) and submitted to the OACP. This information was an important input for OACP's peace policy with reliable and updated information. Eight Public documents were also drafted by the FIP on the political, social, economic and environmental context of these regions and published in the web portal "Verdad Abierta", contributing to the national debate on the situation in these regions.
